intro: Brachypodium mexicanum var. inerme, commonly known as Mexican false brome, is a grass species native to Central America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The leaves are narrow and linear, with a rough texture and prominent veins. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing tiny, two-lobed flowers. This plant is often found in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields.
